page.title: 07THE VILLAGE OF FITZHEAD
page.content: Washers Farm is 600 years old .There are interesting parts to the house, which include a smoke chamber,and Elizabethan staircase.This is a working farm consisting of160 acres of grazing land for dairy cattle. The coach House Pottery Workshop is in Higher Fitzhead.It is complete with wheels,tools,clay and glazes.The pottery shop opens from Monday to Friday and attracts tourists and villagers.It sells jugs,mugs and plates.An evening class is held on Wednesday. Also in the village is the Fitzhead Arms and next door the Post Office in what used to be the Smithy.The old Primary School has been converted into a private dwelling. Fitzhead is thought to be a very friendly place.
